ANU.name: Md Zakir HOSSAIN
ANU.colleges: College of Engineering & Computer ScienceCollege of Science
interest: Bioinformatics Computer Vision Machine Learning Human-Centred Computing Biological Computing Google Scholar Link: https://bit.ly/2CREur0Available Student Projects: https://bit.ly/3aVk3doResearch activities and scholarships: http://users.cecs.anu.edu.au/~u5710140/research_opportunity.html
ANU.biography: Dr Zakir received the BSc degree in 2011 and the MSc degree in 2014 in Electrical and Electronic Engineering from Khulna University of Engineering & Technology (KUET) in Bangladesh. He served as a Lecturer in the University of Information Technology and Science, Bangladesh for six months in 2012. Later on, he joined as a Lecturer at KUET in 2012 and upgraded his position into Assistant Professor in 2014. He started PhD in the Research School of Computer Science (RSCS) at the Australian National University (ANU) in 2015 and was conferred the degree on 19 July 2019. He has been working as a tutor with ANU College of Engineering and Computer Science (CECS) and as a Research Assistant with RSCS and ANU College of Business and Economics. He was also a casual tutor for the Faculty of Science and Technology at University of Canberra. He completed his first postdoc with RSCS and Our Health in Our Hands (OHIOH) project at ANU. He also worked for short-term Postdoc with the Cetre for Health Informatics at Macquarie University, North Ryde, Sydney. Currently, Dr Zakir is a Research Fellow at Biological Data Science Institute (BDSI), ANU and CSIRO, Canberra. He is also a honorary leturer for RSCS, ANU.
